buildup.text: A variable is a name that points to a value: like a label on a box.

discovery.text: If the box label says score and the value is 10, you can use score anywhere instead of rewriting 10.

twist.text: The label stays the same, but the value can change: score becomes 11, then 12, as the game continues.

climax.text: Thatâ€™s why variables matter: they make programs flexible â€” names describe meaning, values change over time.

punchline.text: Variable = a named place to store a value. Labels for numbers, text, and everything else.
